options.name: Create
options.description: Create a new ticket

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete a ticket

options.name: Get
options.description: Get a ticket

options.name: Get Many
options.description: Get many tickets

options.name: Update
options.description: Update a ticket

properties.name: requester
properties.description: Email address of the requester. If no contact exists with this email address in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact.

options.name: Email
options.description: Email address of the requester. If no contact exists with this email address in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact.

options.name: Facebook ID
options.description: Facebook ID of the requester. If no contact exists with this facebook_id, then a new contact will be created.

options.name: Phone
options.description: Phone number of the requester. If no contact exists with this phone number in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact. If the phone number is set and the email address is not, then the name attribute is mandatory.

options.name: Requester ID
options.description: User ID of the requester. For existing contacts, the requester_id can be passed instead of the requester's email.

options.name: Twitter ID
options.description: Twitter handle of the requester. If no contact exists with this handle in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact.

options.name: Unique External ID
options.description: External ID of the requester. If no contact exists with this external ID in Freshdesk, they will be added as a new contact.

properties.name: source
properties.description: The channel through which the ticket was created

properties.name: options
properties.description: ID of the agent to whom the ticket has been assigned. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: agent
options.description: ID of the agent to whom the ticket has been assigned. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: ccEmails
options.description: Separated by a comma (,) email addresses added in the 'cc' field of the incoming ticket email

options.name: company
options.description: Company ID of the requester. This attribute can only be set if the Multiple Companies feature is enabled (Estate plan and above). Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: description
options.description: HTML content of the ticket

options.name: dueBy
options.description: Timestamp that denotes when the ticket is due to be resolved

options.name: emailConfigId
options.description: ID of email config which is used for this ticket. (i.e., support@yourcompany.com/sales@yourcompany.com) If product_id is given and email_config_id is not given, product's primary email_config_id will be set.

options.name: frDueBy
options.description: Timestamp that denotes when the first response is due

options.name: group
options.description: ID of the group to which the ticket has been assigned. The default value is the ID of the group that is associated with the given email_config_id. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: name
options.description: Name of the requester

options.name: product
options.description: ID of the product to which the ticket is associated. It will be ignored if the email_config_id attribute is set in the request. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: subject
options.description: Subject of the ticket

options.name: tags
options.description: Separated by a comma (,) tags that have been associated with the ticket

options.name: type
options.description: Helps categorize the ticket according to the different kinds of issues your support team deals with

properties.name: customFieldsUi
properties.description: Key value pairs containing the names and values of custom fields.

properties.name: customFieldsJson
properties.description: Key value pairs containing the names and values of custom fields.

properties.name: updateFields
properties.description: ID of the agent to whom the ticket has been assigned. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: agent
options.description: ID of the agent to whom the ticket has been assigned. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: ccEmails
options.description: Separated by a comma (,) email addresses added in the 'cc' field of the incoming ticket email

options.name: company
options.description: Company ID of the requester. This attribute can only be set if the Multiple Companies feature is enabled (Estate plan and above). Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: dueBy
options.description: Timestamp that denotes when the ticket is due to be resolved

options.name: emailConfigId
options.description: ID of email config which is used for this ticket. (i.e., support@yourcompany.com/sales@yourcompany.com) If product_id is given and email_config_id is not given, product's primary email_config_id will be set.

options.name: frDueBy
options.description: Timestamp that denotes when the first response is due

options.name: group
options.description: ID of the group to which the ticket has been assigned. The default value is the ID of the group that is associated with the given email_config_id. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: name
options.description: Name of the requester

options.name: product
options.description: ID of the product to which the ticket is associated. It will be ignored if the email_config_id attribute is set in the request. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: requester
options.description: Email address of the requester. If no contact exists with this email address in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact.

options.name: Email
options.description: Email address of the requester. If no contact exists with this email address in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact.

options.name: Facebook ID
options.description: Facebook ID of the requester. If no contact exists with this facebook_id, then a new contact will be created.

options.name: Phone
options.description: Phone number of the requester. If no contact exists with this phone number in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact. If the phone number is set and the email address is not, then the name attribute is mandatory.

options.name: Requester ID
options.description: User ID of the requester. For existing contacts, the requester_id can be passed instead of the requester's email.

options.name: Twitter ID
options.description: Twitter handle of the requester. If no contact exists with this handle in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact.

options.name: Unique External ID
options.description: External ID of the requester. If no contact exists with this external ID in Freshdesk, they will be added as a new contact.

options.name: requesterIdentificationValue
options.description: Value of the identification selected

options.name: source
options.description: The channel through which the ticket was created

options.name: tags
options.description: Separated by a comma (,) tags that have been associated with the ticket

options.name: type
options.description: Helps categorize the ticket according to the different kinds of issues your support team deals with

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

properties.name: options
properties.description: Order sort attribute ascending or descending

options.name: order
options.description: Order sort attribute ascending or descending

options.name: orderBy
options.description: Sort collection by object attribute

options.name: Create
options.description: Create a new contact

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete a contact

options.name: Get
options.description: Get a contact

options.name: Get Many
options.description: Get many contacts

options.name: Update
options.description: Update a contact

properties.name: email
properties.description: Primary email address of the contact. If you want to associate additional email(s) with this contact, use the other_emails attribute.

options.name: address
options.description: Address of the contact

options.name: avatar
options.description:
Avatar image of the contact The maximum file size is 5MB
			// 	and the supported file types are .jpg, .jpeg, .jpe, and .png.

options.name: company_id
options.description: ID of the primary company to which this contact belongs

options.name: customFields
options.description: Key value pairs containing the name and value of the custom field. Only dates in the format YYYY-MM-DD are accepted as input for custom date fields.

options.name: description
options.description: A small description of the contact

options.name: email
options.description: Primary email address of the contact. If you want to associate additional email(s) with this contact, use the other_emails attribute.

options.name: job_title
options.description: Job title of the contact

options.name: language
options.description: Language of the contact. Default language is "en". This attribute can only be set if the Multiple Language feature is enabled (Garden plan and above).

options.name: mobile
options.description: Mobile number of the contact

options.name: name
options.description: Name of the contact

options.name: other_companies
options.description: Additional companies associated with the contact. This attribute can only be set if the Multiple Companies feature is enabled (Estate plan and above).

options.name: other_emails
options.description: Additional emails associated with the contact

options.name: phone
options.description: Telephone number of the contact

options.name: tags
options.description: Tags associated with this contact

options.name: time_zone
options.description: Time zone of the contact. Default value is the time zone of the domain. This attribute can only be set if the Multiple Time Zone feature is enabled (Garden plan and above).

options.name: twitter_id
options.description: Twitter handle of the contact

options.name: unique_external_id
options.description: External ID of the contact

options.name: view_all_tickets
options.description: Whether the contact can see all the tickets that are associated with the company to which they belong

possibleValues.name: Email
possibleValues.description: Email address of the requester. If no contact exists with this email address in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact.

possibleValues.name: Facebook ID
possibleValues.description: Facebook ID of the requester. If no contact exists with this facebook_id, then a new contact will be created.

possibleValues.name: Phone
possibleValues.description: Phone number of the requester. If no contact exists with this phone number in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact. If the phone number is set and the email address is not, then the name attribute is mandatory.

possibleValues.name: Requester ID
possibleValues.description: User ID of the requester. For existing contacts, the requester_id can be passed instead of the requester's email.

possibleValues.name: Twitter ID
possibleValues.description: Twitter handle of the requester. If no contact exists with this handle in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact.

possibleValues.name: Unique External ID
possibleValues.description: External ID of the requester. If no contact exists with this external ID in Freshdesk, they will be added as a new contact.

notes.name: Notes
notes.description: Optional note to save with the node

notesInFlow.name: Display Note in Flow?
notesInFlow.description: If active, the note above will display in the flow as a subtitle

alwaysOutputData.name: Always Output Data
alwaysOutputData.description: If active, will output a single, empty item when the output would have been empty. Use to prevent the workflow finishing on this node

executeOnce.name: Execute Once
executeOnce.description: If active, the node executes only once, with data from the first item it receives

retryOnFail.name: Retry On Fail
retryOnFail.description: If active, the node tries to execute again when it fails

maxTries.name: Max. Tries
maxTries.description: Number of times to attempt to execute the node before failing the execution

waitBetweenTries.name: Wait Between Tries (ms)
waitBetweenTries.description: How long to wait between each attempt (in milliseconds)

onError.name: On Error
onError.description: Action to take when the node execution fails

options.name: Stop Workflow
options.description: Halt execution and fail workflow

options.name: Continue
options.description: Pass error message as item in regular output

options.name: Continue (using error output)
options.description: Pass item to an extra `error` output

settings.note: Executable nodes have both common and executable settings
